step1.sentence: Bringing up the old contract during the meeting opened a can of worms that no one was prepared to deal with.

step2.story: Mark thought asking his team about the new project timeline would be a quick check-in, but he opened a can of worms instead. Every person raised a different concern — unclear roles, missing resources, conflicting deadlines — and what was meant to be a fifteen-minute chat stretched into an exhausting two-hour debate.

step3.story: Sarah had worked at the nonprofit for three years without ever questioning the budget process. One afternoon, she casually asked a senior director why certain funds were allocated to one department over another. She had no idea she was opening a can of worms. Within days, emails were flying between directors, old grievances resurfaced, and an emergency board meeting was called. What had started as a simple question spiraled into a full organizational audit. Sarah wished she had stayed quiet, but deep down she knew these problems had needed to surface for a long time.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 행동이나 질문이 의도치 않게 복잡하고 해결하기 어려운 문제들을 드러내거나 불러일으킬 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 낚시 미끼용 벌레를 담은 캔을 열면 벌레들이 사방으로 퍼져 다시 주워 담기 어렵다는 이미지에서 유래한 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 보통 후회나 경고의 뉘앙스를 담고 있으며, 건드리지 않았으면 더 나았을 복잡한 문제가 터질 때 쓴다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Asking about the pay gap opened a can of worms at the company.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 임금 격차에 대해 물어보자 회사에서 복잡한 문제들이 터져 나왔다.
